Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Vehemence \Ve"he*mence\, n. [L. vehementia: cf. F. v['e]h['e]mence.] [1913 Webster] 1. The quality pr state of being vehement; impetuous force; impetuosity; violence; fury; as, the vehemence. [1913 Webster]
2. Violent ardor; great heat; animated fervor; as, the vehemence of love, anger, or other passions. [1913 Webster]
I . . . tremble at his vehemence of temper. --Addison. [1913 Webster]

vehemence n 1: intensity or forcefulness of expression; "the vehemence of his denial"; "his emphasis on civil rights" [syn: {emphasis}] 2: the property of being wild or turbulent; "the storm's violence" [syn: {ferocity}, {fierceness}, {furiousness}, {fury}, {violence}, {wildness}]
